content.webTitle: Filtronic sells mobile unit to US

fields.headline: Filtronic sells mobile unit to US
fields.bodyText: British electronics group Filtronic yesterday announced the long-awaited sale of its mobile phone products business to US-based Technitrol for €67m (£46m). Finland-based LK Products makes antennas for mobile phones and counts Nokia among its major customers. Last year it had sales of £50m, down 17% year on year and profit dipped to £3.6m from £11.2m. Yorkshire-based Filtronic plans to use the cash raised to pay off its £44m worth of long-term debt, in a move that will wipe out extensive annual repayments and free up cash to invest in the underlying business. Filtronic will earn further cash depending on the performance of the business. Technitrol will pay Filtronic €1 for every €1 of revenue LK Products makes over €85m in the year to the end of May, 2006.
